page.title: 11MAYDAY 1985
page.content: On May 6th we had a Bank Holiday which meant that everybody had a day off work.The village held a Street Market in Church Street.The stalls opened at 10 o'clock and a lot of people came from other villages.They parked their cars in a field and so many came that it was soon full.There was a Maypole on the grass near the church and all the children had a ribbon and danced around it.The Royal Newton drum band came and there was a May Queen who arrived carried by four men.She was brought in through the church gate and put down on the grass with her two attendants.The vicars wife crowned the May Queen.There was crazy golf and three tombola stalls.The schools tombola was for soft toys all the money raised to go to school funds.There were refreshments in the village hall. Sally Oldfield Age 10
